title: Can you have two broadband suppliers in one house? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depending on where you live and whether there are multiple service providers available at the ‘tap’ (i.e. utility pole, commuication box, etc.) serving your neighborhood/home, yes it is possible to have two broadband suppliers to a single home. If service is hardwired, you will also need separate drops to the home and depending on the type of service, specific cable for each…either traditional coax cable or FiOS for fiber.

We have two broadband suppliers in our household. The upstairs and downstairs are separate suites and the person downstairs prefers cable so he has broadband through the cable company and I prefer the telco which uses fiber optics now so the upstairs gets internet, phone and TV via the telco and the downstairs gets the same via the cable company. The cable company also uses fiber but only to the neighborhood. “The last mile” as it’s referred to is still coaxial cable whereas the telco is right to the house.
